page.title: 09THE OLD CHURCH,PORCHFIELD
page.content: Walking between the Inn and the Post Office along the Porchfield Road,there is an old high stone wall surmounted only by the leaves of trees,quite a usual sight here,but there is something more _ a green ivyed archway,marking a break in the wall, with old rusty gate and path narrowed by branches and weeds.There is a clue to this overgrown garden,a leaning headstone.Through the gate more gravestones appear,finally amongst the bushes rises an old church.Clearly through the leaves the nailed door and boarded windows can be seen.It stands with fallen slates,spireless and unused.A small square of the graveyard has been cleared,here lie two graves neatly tended with flowers, recent among their forgotten companions.
